text: Indeed it was the right Choice...but the Client don‘t have the Professional Package

I’ve got a comparison chart on a page and the client want’s to know how users are interacting with it, (basically which product’s they are selecting in the drop downs to compare)
I was thinking of just creating a form for each dropdown and submiting with the api each time a change event occurs, does anyone know of if there’s a better way to do this?
Maybe a JS function that has an event listener on change of the select and when it happens push the event via api?
What would you push the event to though? is forms the best way?

Just found the events manager and events api, that’s what i wanted
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/JavaScript_events_api>
Ah but i can’t submit the product names

I don’t think that there’s technically a right or wrong answer here - but I’m writing something and wanted to get people’s opinion.

*Thank you pages - should they be built as Landing Pages or Website Pages in HubSpot?* why do you feel your choice makes sense?

well, I assume you have to compare two or more items, so you can do an hubdb table, with some columns and do a row for any type of comparison and before push you can also check if there is already a comparation between the config
example, in an hubdb you will have product1, product2, comparationTimes
and you can popolate those field with the users input
<@U5SGFUU80> handful of folks already have a conversation going <#CCGU4R4ER|extend> :slightly_smiling_face:
most of the conversation so far has been around how do we make an “emmet’s bar” a reality in boston during inbound
emmet being a reference to HubSpot devs wanting <https://emmet.io/>, in the design manager

LP is what I've always been told. The lazy me says that it's just a nice way to keep the associated LP/TY combo in the same tool. Plus, I feel like my OCD would notice the change in URL and that would bother me (but maybe I'm weird). I like it becuase it's just a way to be consistent and organized
both valid points, I lean that way as well. Wasn’t even thinking of the fact that you can use a different domain or subdomain for landing pages. That’s pretty important.
:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing: Fantastic!
don't worry, this is how I feel for every question I ask in this slack :upside_down_face::slightly_smiling_face::upside_down_face::slightly_smiling_face: haha

Huge congrats <@UGA6NJFUM>!!
> - What was your favorite part?
> - How we might improve it?

cc <@U3PKJ8EQL>
I'll add some language about this in the welcome bot messages and try to make it clear. :slightly_smiling_face:
You could probably just track with Google Analytics events tracking as well. If your using tag manager it might be even easier

topic: General HubSpot developer discussion, collaboration and fun. :rotating_light:Not an official HubSpot support channel :rotating_light: For urgent issues, plz contact HubSpot Support. For less urgent issues, please post in <http://bit.ly/HubSpotdevform>
text: set the channel topic: General HubSpot developer discussion, collaboration and fun. :rotating_light:Not an official HubSpot support channel :rotating_light: For urgent issues, plz contact HubSpot Support. For less urgent issues, please post in <http://bit.ly/HubSpotdevform>

wording could maybe still use a little finagling but it might help.

somehow stating - the slack is for community devs to help eachother, and if you need help specific to a topic that there is a channel for - ask it in the relevant channel

We're looking for more *beta testers* for the new :sprocket: *CMS developer Code Gallery*!

what is it?

The Code Gallery is a showcase of the open-source assets and projects our developer community is working on.

huzzah!  i would love to beta test that
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/batch_create_or_update>
Cool - will DM you <@UD53A9UUR>
i would like to as well!
whichever dev implemented the proxy option under URL redirects. I think I owe you beer now

I do have a serious question though -

so I have a blog that for the listing page I’m proxying a website page. The website page is still accessible at it’s main URL as well as the new proxy url.

This means this will likely get indexed, and theoretically someone could land on this website page directly.

*Should I 301 redirect the page to the blog listing page URL which is a proxy of the website page? or will that take down a fleet of HubSpot servers.*
<@U6GNQ7JBU> - tagging you because I feel like you would know something regarding this
Matt is hitting the slopes today :skier:

ahh, good for him, man deserves it.

Any idea who might know about this possible infinite loop of doom?
I believe that would indeed create a loop of doom.
danm….
then the proxy feature isn’t ultimately super useful since using it would hurt SEO (duplicate content)
hmm…. I’d do a noindex no follow on the website page but that’d be carried into the proxy… this is a conundrum
Hey is there a setting on HubSpot to clear caching or disable it? After saving files and modules its taking ages to demonstrate the change.
You could block with robots txt file
<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/So-you're-having-HubSpot-Caching-Issues%3F>
But you bring up a good point
the proxy feature though is great, I can see some killer capabilities with this
like putting manifest files for pwas at their root like browsers want them to be

Hi, i am interested what your opinions are on the proposed article 6 of the EU, the so called “terror-filter”…in my opinion a lot of the things that it demands are technologically very challenging, if not completely impossible. It could even prevent us from directly uploading images to HS and using them instantly, because HS would need to check them for Terror Content
Thanks Jon!
In my opinion there would need to be an upload filter for everything that gets uploaded to HubSpot and every other SaaS / Hosting Provider
which would be pretty bad in addition to Articles 11, 12 and 13 who are also pretty severe
and service workers
eggsmacktly
I believe there is still an issue with proxying to files on file manager though, so that might not work quite yet
k, I’ll hold off on that front for now

I do think some thinking could be done on this proxying a site page - duplicate content issue though- unfortunately probably needs a UI toggle to go “should going directly to destination URL take people to the proxy url instead”
I think for most pages a regular redirect is better. Proxy is more useful for hosting special files at the root and such.
right but this situation a redirect doesn’t really solve the problem and feels dirty
